text: The Yale Bulldogs represented Yale University in ECAC women's ice hockey during the 2014–15 NCAA Division I women's ice hockey season. The Bulldogs were defeated by Harvard in the ECAC quarterfinals. ==Offseason== *July 10:Hanna Åström was invited to a second National Team camp for Sweden. *August 3: Jaimie Leonoff and Eden Murray were invited to Team Canada'a Development camp in Calgary. ===Recruiting=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- style="text-align:center; background:#00356B; color:#fff;" | Player || Position ||Nationality || Notes |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Kara Drexler || Defense || || played for the Anaheim Lady Ducks |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Kaitlin Gately || Forward || || Played with Assabet Valley |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Emily Monaghan || Forward || || Attended Edge School with Eden Murray |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Eden Murray || Forward || || Younger sister of Sr. Defense Madi Murray |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Courtney Pensavalle || Forward || || Played for Team Pittsburgh |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Mallory Souliotis || Defense || || On Assabet Valley team with Kaitlin Gately |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Brittany Wheeler || Forward || || Attended Benilde-St, Margaret's |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Grace Wickens || Defense || || Played with Toronto Jr. Aeros |- align="center" bgcolor=" " |} == 2014–15 Bulldogs == ==Schedule== |- !colspan=12 style=" style="background:#00356B; color:#fff;"| Regular Season |- !colspan=12 style=" style="background:#00356B; color:#fff;"| ECAC Tournament ==References== Yale Category:Yale Bulldogs women's ice hockey seasons Yale Bulldogs Yale Bulldogs
